project.name: Pixi.js API
project.description: Pixi.js is a fast lightweight 2D library that works across all devices.

AssetLoader.name: AssetLoader
AssetLoader.description:
A Class that loads a bunch of images / sprite sheet files. Once the assets have been loaded they are added to the PIXI Texture cache and can be accessed easily through PIXI.Texture.fromFrame(), PIXI.Texture.fromImage() and PIXI.Sprite.fromImage(), PIXI.Sprite.fromFromeId()
When all items have been loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event
As each individual item is loaded this class will dispatch a 'progress' event

params.name: assetURLs
params.description: an array of image/sprite sheet urls that you would like loaded supported. Supported image formats include "jpeg", "jpg", "png", "gif". Supported sprite sheet data formats only include "JSON" at this time

SpriteSheetLoader.name: SpriteSheetLoader
SpriteSheetLoader.description:
The sprite sheet loader is used to load in JSON sprite sheet data
To generate the data you can use http://www.codeandweb.com/texturepacker and publish the "JSON" format
There is a free version so thats nice, although the paid version is great value for money.
It is highly recommended to use Sprite sheets (also know as texture atlas') as it means sprite's can be batched and drawn together for highly increased rendering speed.
Once the data has been loaded the frames are stored in the PIXI texture cache and can be accessed though PIXI.Texture.fromFrameId() and PIXI.Sprite.fromFromeId()
This loader will also load the image file that the Spritesheet points to as well as the data.
When loaded this class will dispatch a 'loaded' event

params.name: url
params.description: the url of the sprite sheet JSON file

CanvasRenderer.name: CanvasRenderer
CanvasRenderer.description:
the CanvasRenderer draws the stage and all its content onto a 2d canvas. This renderer should be used for browsers that do not support webGL.
Dont forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

params.name: width
params.description: the width of the canvas view

params.name: height
params.description: the height of the canvas view

params.name: view
params.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

WebGLBatch.name: WebGLBatch
WebGLBatch.description:
A WebGLBatch Enables a group of sprites to be drawn using the same settings.
if a group of sprites all have the same baseTexture and blendMode then they can be grouped into a batch. All the sprites in a batch can then be drawn in one go by the GPU which is hugely efficient. ALL sprites in the webGL renderer are added to a batch even if the batch only contains one sprite. Batching is handled automatically by the webGL renderer. A good tip is: the smaller the number of batchs there are, the faster the webGL renderer will run.

params.name: an
params.description: instance of the webGL context

WebGLRenderer.name: WebGLRenderer
WebGLRenderer.description:
the WebGLRenderer is draws the stage and all its content onto a webGL enabled canvas. This renderer should be used for browsers support webGL. This Render works by automatically managing webGLBatchs. So no need for Sprite Batch's or Sprite Cloud's
Dont forget to add the view to your DOM or you will not see anything :)

params.name: width
params.description: the width of the canvas view

params.name: height
params.description: the height of the canvas view

params.name: view
params.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

BaseTexture.name: BaseTexture
BaseTexture.description: A texture stores the information that represents an image. All textures have a base texture

params.name: source
params.description: the source object (image or canvas)

Texture.name: Texture
Texture.description: A texture stores the information that represents an image or part of an image. It cannot be added to the display list directly. To do this use PIXI.Sprite. If no frame is provided then the whole image is used

DisplayObject.name: DisplayObject
DisplayObject.description: this is the base class for all objects that are rendered on the screen.

DisplayObjectContainer.name: DisplayObjectContainer
DisplayObjectContainer.description: A DisplayObjectContainer represents a collection of display objects. It is the base class of all display objects that act as a container for other objects.

InteractionManager.name: InteractionManager
InteractionManager.description:
The interaction manager deals with mouse and touch events. At this moment only Sprite's can be interactive.
This manager also supports multitouch.

MovieClip.name: MovieClip
MovieClip.description: A MovieClip is a simple way to display an animation depicted by a list of textures.

params.name: textures
params.description: an array of {Texture} objects that make up the animation

Point.name: Point
Point.description: The Point object represents a location in a two-dimensional coordinate system, where x represents the horizontal axis and y represents the vertical axis.

params.name: x
params.description: position of the point

params.name: y
params.description: position of the point

Rectangle.name: Rectangle
Rectangle.description: the Rectangle object is an area defined by its position, as indicated by its top-left corner point (x, y) and by its width and its height.

params.name: x
params.description: position of the rectangle

params.name: y
params.description: position of the rectangle

params.name: width
params.description: of the rectangle

params.name: height
params.description: of the rectangle

Stage.name: Stage
Stage.description: A Stage represents the root of the display tree. Everything connected to the stage is rendered

params.name: backgroundColor
params.description: the background color of the stage

params.name: interactive
params.description: enable / disable interaction (default is false)

classitems.description: The array of asset URLs that are going to be loaded

classitems.description: Fired when all the assets have loaded

classitems.description: This will begin loading the assets sequentially
This will begin loading the JSON file
The width of the canvas view
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the canvas view

classitems.description: The canvas element that the everything is drawn to

classitems.description: The canvas context that the everything is drawn to

classitems.description: Renders the stage to its canvas view

params.name: stage
params.description: the Stage element to be rendered

classitems.description: resizes the canvas view to the specified width and height

params.description: new width of the canvas view

params.name: the
params.description: new height of the canvas view

classitems.description: Cleans the batch so that is can be returned to an object pool and reused
inits the batch's texture and blend mode based if the supplied sprite
classitems.name: init

params.name: sprite
params.description: the first sprite to be added to the batch. Only sprites with the same base texture and blend mode will be allowed to be added to this batch

classitems.description: inserts a sprite before the specified sprite
classitems.name: insertBefore

params.name: sprite
params.description: the sprite to be added

params.name: nextSprite
params.description: the first sprite will be inserted before this sprite

classitems.description: inserts a sprite after the specified sprite
classitems.name: insertAfter

params.name: sprite
params.description: the sprite to be added

params.name: previousSprite
params.description: the first sprite will be inserted after this sprite

classitems.description: removes a sprite from the batch
classitems.name: remove

params.name: sprite
params.description: the sprite to be removed

classitems.description: Splits the batch into two with the specified sprite being the start of the new batch.
classitems.name: split

params.name: sprite
params.description: the sprite that indicates where the batch should be split

classitems.description: Merges two batchs together
classitems.name: merge

params.name: batch
params.description: the batch that will be merged

classitems.description: Grows the size of the batch. As the elements in the batch cannot have a dynamic size this function is used to increase the size of the batch. It also creates a little extra room so that the batch does not need to be resized every time a sprite is added
Refresh's all the data in the batch and sync's it with the webGL buffers
classitems.name: refresh

classitems.description: Updates all the relevant geometry and uploads the data to the GPU
classitems.name: update

classitems.description: Draws the batch to the frame buffer
classitems.name: render

classitems.description: Renders the stage to its webGL view
classitems.name: render

params.name: stage
params.description: the PIXI.Stage element to be rendered

classitems.description: resizes the webGL view to the specified width and height
classitems.name: resize

params.name: width
params.description: the new width of the webGL view

params.name: height
params.description: the new height of the webGL view

classitems.description: [read only] The width of the base texture set when the image has loaded
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: [read only] The height of the base texture set when the image has loaded
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: The source that is loaded to create the texture
classitems.name: source

classitems.description: The base texture of this texture
classitems.name: baseTexture

classitems.description: The frame specifies the region of the base texture that this texture uses
classitems.name: frame

classitems.description: Specifies the rectangle region of the baseTexture
classitems.name: setFrame

classitems.description:
Helper function that returns a texture based on an image url
 If the image is not in the texture cache it will be  created and loaded
classitems.name: fromImage

params.name: imageUrl
params.description: The image url of the texture

classitems.description:
Helper function that returns a texture based on a frame id
 If the frame id is not in the texture cache an error will be thrown
classitems.name: fromFrame

params.name: frameId
params.description: The frame id of the texture

classitems.description:
Helper function that returns a texture based on a canvas element
 If the canvas is not in the texture cache it will be  created and loaded
classitems.name: fromCanvas

params.name: canvas
params.description: The canvas element source of the texture

classitems.description: Adds a texture to the textureCache.
classitems.name: addTextureToCache

params.name: id
params.description: the id that the texture will be stored against.

classitems.description: Remove a texture from the textureCache.
classitems.name: removeTextureFromCache

params.name: id
params.description: the id of the texture to be removed

classitems.description:
This helper function will automatically detect which renderer you should be using.
WebGL is the preferred renderer as it is a lot fastest. If webGL is not supported by the browser then this function will return a canvas renderer
classitems.name: autoDetectRenderer

params.name: width
params.description: the width of the renderers view

params.name: height
params.description: the height of the renderers view

params.name: view
params.description: the canvas to use as a view, optional

classitems.description:
https://github.com/mrdoob/eventtarget.js/
THankS mr DOob!
Provides requestAnimationFrame in a cross browser way.
Provides bind in a cross browser way.
The coordinate of the object relative to the local coordinates of the parent.
classitems.name: position

classitems.description: The scale factor of the object.
classitems.name: scale

classitems.description: The rotation of the object in radians.
classitems.name: rotation

classitems.description: The opacity of the object.
classitems.name: alpha

classitems.description: The visibility of the object.
classitems.name: visible

classitems.description: [read-only] The display object container that contains this display object.
classitems.name: parent

classitems.description: [read-only] The stage the display object is connected to, or undefined if it is not connected to the stage.
classitems.name: stage

classitems.description: [read-only] The of children of this container.
classitems.name: children

classitems.description: Adds a child to the container.
classitems.name: addChild

classitems.description: Adds a child to the container at a specified index. If the index is out of bounds an error will be thrown
classitems.name: addChildAt

classitems.description: Removes a child from the container.
classitems.name: removeChild

classitems.description: a refference to the stage
classitems.name: stage

classitems.description: the mouse data
classitems.name: mouse

classitems.description: an object that stores current touches (InteractionData) by id reference
classitems.name: touchs

classitems.description:
This method will disable rollover/rollout for ALL interactive items
You may wish to use this an optimization if your app does not require rollover/rollout funcitonality
classitems.name: disableMouseOver

classitems.description:
This method will enable rollover/rollout for ALL interactive items
It is enabled by default
classitems.name: enableMouseOver

classitems.description: This point stores the global coords of where the touch/mouse event happened
classitems.name: global

classitems.description: This point stores the local coords of where the touch/mouse event happened
classitems.name: local

classitems.description: The target Sprite that was interacted with
classitems.name: target

classitems.description: The array of textures that make up the animation
classitems.name: textures

classitems.description: [read only] The index MovieClips current frame (this may not have to be a whole number)
classitems.name: currentFrame

classitems.description: The speed that the MovieClip will play at. Higher is faster, lower is slower
classitems.name: animationSpeed

classitems.description: [read only] indicates if the MovieClip is currently playing
classitems.name: playing

classitems.description: Stops the MovieClip
classitems.name: stop

classitems.description: Plays the MovieClip
classitems.name: play

classitems.description: Stops the MovieClip and goes to a specific frame
classitems.name: gotoAndStop

params.name: frameNumber
params.description: frame index to stop at

classitems.description: Goes to a specific frame and begins playing the MovieClip
classitems.name: gotoAndPlay

params.name: frameNumber
params.description: frame index to start at

classitems.description:
The anchor sets the origin point of the texture.
The default is 0,0 this means the textures origin is the top left 
Setting than anchor to 0.5,0.5 means the textures origin is centered
Setting the anchor to 1,1 would mean the textures origin points will be the bottom right
classitems.name: anchor

classitems.description: The texture that the sprite is using
classitems.name: texture

classitems.description:
The blend mode of sprite.
currently supports PIXI.blendModes.NORMAL and PIXI.blendModes.SCREEN
classitems.name: blendMode

classitems.description: The width of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)
classitems.name: width

classitems.description: The height of the sprite (this is initially set by the texture)
classitems.name: height

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users clicks on the sprite with thier mouse
classitems.name: click

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user clicks the mouse down over the sprite
classitems.name: mousedown

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the mouse that was over the sprite
for this callback to be fired the mouse must have been pressed down over the sprite
classitems.name: mouseup

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users mouse rolls over the sprite
classitems.name: mouseover

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the users mouse leaves the sprite
classitems.name: mouseout

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the users taps on the sprite with thier finger
basically a touch version of click
classitems.name: tap

classitems.description: A callback that is used when the user touch's over the sprite
classitems.name: touchstart

classitems.description:
A callback that is used when the user releases the touch that was over the sprite
for this callback to be fired. The touch must have started over the sprite
classitems.name: touchend

params.name: texture
params.description: The PIXI texture that is displayed by the sprite

classitems.description: Indicates if the sprite will have touch and mouse interactivity. It is false by default
classitems.name: setInteractive

classitems.description:
Helper function that creates a sprite that will contain a texture from the TextureCache based on the frameId
 The frame ids are created when a Texture packer file has been loaded
classitems.name: fromFrame

params.name: frameId
params.description: The frame Id of the texture in the cache

return.description: A new Sprite using a texture from the texture cache matching the frameId

classitems.description:
Helper function that creates a sprite that will contain a texture based on an image url
 If the image is not in the texture cache it will be loaded
classitems.name: fromImage

params.name: The
params.description: image url of the texture

return.description: A new Sprite using a texture from the texture cache matching the image id
